intro: Legnephora philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine legume tree, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The seeds are enclosed in elongated pods and are often used in traditional medicine and as a source of protein.
